summary.event: ACM / IEEE 28th International Conference on Model Driven Engineering Languages and Systems (MODELS)
summary.description: MODELS, the ACM/IEEE International Conference on Model-Driven Engineering Languages and Systems, is the premier conference series for model-driven software and systems engineering, organized with support of ACM SIGSOFT and IEEE TCSE. MODELS 2025 will host a number of workshops providing a collaborative forum for participants.

workshops.title: International Workshop on Collaborative and Participatory Modeling (CoPaMo 2025)
workshops.description: Collaborative modeling is a key enabler to engineering complex systems.

workshops.title: 2nd International Workshop on Sustainability and Modeling (SusMod’25)
workshops.description: This workshop aims to unearth visceral links between sustainability and MDE.

workshops.title: MDE Intelligence: 7th Workshop on Artificial Intelligence and Model-driven Engineering
workshops.description: Discusses the incorporation of AI techniques in Model-Driven Engineering.

workshops.title: Modeling Language Engineering (MLE)
workshops.description: Aims to discuss the challenges associated with the engineering of modeling languages.

workshops.title: MULTI 2025
workshops.description: Provides a platform for exchanging ideas on multi-level modeling.

workshops.title: Models and Evolution 2025 (ME 2025)
workshops.description: Focuses on the evolution of models in MDE.

workshops.title: Second International Workshop on Model Management (MoM)
workshops.description: Aims to improve state-of-the-art in Model Management.

workshops.title: LowCode 2025: Low-Code Development Platforms
workshops.description: Explores collaboration between low-code platforms and MDE.

workshops.title: MoDeVVa’25: Model Driven Engineering, Verification and Validation
workshops.description: Focuses on verification and validation in MBSE and MDE.

workshops.title: onto:Nexus Ontological Modeling and Analysis Workshop
workshops.description: Discussion space for ontological modeling in model-based engineering.

workshops.title: MoDIoT – 1st International Workshop on Model-Based Development for the IoT
workshops.description: Discussion on model-based development addressing challenges of IoT.
